panels.description: ######    The amount of time spent by the CPU in various states, most notably executing user code, executing system code, waiting for IO-operations and being idle.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description:
#### _Warning(yellow)_
######   if one or more of the following conditions are true:
  * Idle CPU is less than 20%.
  * Load is higher than 5
  * Free memory is less than 1000 MiB;
  * Free space of "/" is less than 10 GiB;
#### _Critial(red)_
 ######   if one or more of the following conditions are true:
  + Idle CPU is less than 5%.
  + Load is higher than 10
  + Free space of "/" is less than 1 GiB;
  + Free memory is less than 100 MiB;

----
######     The system load is defined as the number of runnable tasks in the run-queue and is provided by many operating systems as a one minute average.
panels.title: General Status

panels.description:
######   The values are reported by the operating system.  The categories are: 
 - Used 
 - Buffered 
 - Cached 
 - Free
 - Slab recl
 - Slab unrecl 

----
######   _Free memory_ is memory you paid for, that's using power and that doesn't do anything useful. It is normal that the operating system puts that memory to use.

targets.query: SELECT sum("value") FROM "aggregation.cpu-average.cpu.system" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)

panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: ######   This panel shows the writting rate for each disk.
panels.title: Disk Write Rate

panels.description: ######   This panel shows the reading rate for each disk.
panels.title: Disk Read Rate

panels.description:
######   This value show the usage of the disk which is mounted as Root. There will be three categories:
 - Free
 - Used
 - Reserved

----
###### _Warning_ will be reported when there's a little free space left.
panels.title: Disk Usage on Root

panels.description:
######   The system load is defined as the number of runnable tasks in the run-queue and is provided by many operating systems as:
  - Shortterm --- one minute average
  - Midterm ---  five minutes average
  - Longterm --- fifteen minutes average
panels.title: Load

panels.description: ######   It keeps track of the system uptime, providing informations such as the average running time or the maximum reached uptime over a certain period of time
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: ######   Counts the The number of users currently logged into the system.
panels.title: Users

panels.description: ######   System Temperature is collected by sensors. This panel shows the temperture of these sensors.
panels.title: Temperature

list.label: Server Host Name
list.name: fqdn
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "memory.buffered.memory" WITH KEY = fqdn
